...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING...
...FREEZING RAIN ADVISORY IS CANCELLED...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN NORMAN HAS ISSUED A WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SNOW AND PATCHY FREEZING DRIZZLE...WHICH IS
IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING. A WIND CHILL ADVISORY HAS
ALSO BEEN ISSUED. THIS WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM
CST THIS MORNING. THE FREEZING RAIN ADVISORY HAS BEEN CANCELLED.

* TIMING: THROUGH MID-MORNING WEDNESDAY.

* WIND CHILL VALUES: 5 BELOW TO 10 BELOW.

* SNOW AND ICE ACCUMULATIONS: A LIGHT GLAZING OF ICE AND LESS THAN
  ONE INCH OF SNOW. SLICK SPOTS ON AREA ROADWAYS HAVE ALREADY BEEN
  REPORTED...ESPECIALLY ON BRIDGES AND OVERPASSES.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

BE CAREFUL IF YOU HAVE TO TRAVEL. EVEN SMALL AMOUNTS OF ICE AND
SNOW CAN MAKE ROADS AND SIDEWALKS SLICK AND DANGEROUS.

IF YOU HAVE TO BE OUTSIDE DRESS IN LAYERS AND LEAVE NO SKIN
EXPOSED TO THE WIND. FROSTBITE AND HYPOTHERMIA CAN HAPPEN
QUICKLY.

IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING. THE FREEZING RAIN ADVISORY

* TIMING: THROUGH MID-MORNING WEDNESDAY.

* SNOW AND ICE ACCUMULATIONS: A LIGHT GLAZING OF ICE AND UP TO ONE
  INCH OF SNOW. HIGHER SNOW TOTALS...ON THE ORDER OF A COUPLE OF
  INCHES...IS POSSIBLE NEAR AND JUST NORTH OF BENJAMIN...SEYMOUR...
  AND ARCHER CITY TEXAS. SLICK SPOTS ON AREA ROADWAYS HAVE ALREADY
  BEEN REPORTED...ESPECIALLY ON BRIDGES AND OVERPASSES.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

BE CAREFUL IF YOU HAVE TO TRAVEL. EVEN SMALL AMOUNTS OF FREEZING
DRIZZLE CAN MAKE ROADS AND SIDEWALKS SLICK AND DANGEROUS. IF YOU
MUST TRAVEL...TAKE EXTRA BLANKETS AND WINTER SAFETY ITEMS TO
SURVIVE IN THE COLD IF YOU ARE INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT OR SLIDE
OFF THE ROAD.
